org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.communication

Class ClientMessageBroker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.communication.ClientMessageBroker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientMessageBroker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is responsible for parsing and handling all messages sent to the client. In some way it is the most important class. It consists of two parts:
    • Message receving
    • Message handling

    v1.0 Initial release
    v1.1 Functional changes
    v1.2 Added new messages and depending handling
    Version:
    1.2 (Raphael Stoeckli, 23.10.2014)
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli (v1.0)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientMessageBroker

        public ClientMessageBroker(java.net.Socket socket,
                           ClientGame game)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the ClientMessageBroker and sets up a Socket.
        This class is responsible for parsing, interpreting and passing messages to the game logic (client wise). This class is the counterpart of the ServerMessageBroker on the server side.
        Parameters:
        socket - Socket which connects the server to the client.
        game - A reference to the game
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the message listening loop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • listenForMessages

        private void listenForMessages()
        This method constantly listens for new inputs coming from the server. The messages are first parsed using parseInput(java.lang.String). Then the parsed messages will be handled. System messages will be handled by ServerMessageBroker.checkForNonGameMessages on the server side. All other messages are then passed to the ServerMessageBroker.processGameLogic (also server side) method.

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message message)
        Send the message using the currently configured socket. Use this method whenever possible. The player will be attached and can therefore be identified by the server by using the Message.getPlayer() method.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.

      • parseInput

        private org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parseInput(java.lang.String inputString)
        This method parses the incoming messages.
        It first tries to create a DOMDocument in order to check whether the string is valid xml and to determine the message type. If the message cannot be parsed, the client will receive a BadInputMessage. If the parsing is successful, the respective message class is loaded via the system ClassLoader.
        In a last step, the Message.parse(java.io.StringReader, java.lang.Class<T>) method will take care of the parsing itself.
        Parameters:
        inputString - The message as received from the clients.
        Returns:
        The parsed message.

      • checkForNonGameMessages

        private void checkForNonGameMessages(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        Checks the incoming messages for the following system messages:
        • ForceCloseMessage
        • KeepAliveMessage
        • IdentificationResponseMessage
        • JoinResponseMessage
        • NotifyMessage
        • ExceptionMessage
        • BadInputMessage
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The parsed message.

      • handleNotifyMessage

        private void handleNotifyMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        Handles a notify message from the server. It will only show a message box
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The NotifyMessage.
        Since:
        v1.2

      • handleJoinResponseMessage

        private void handleJoinResponseMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        Handles a message from the server after a joining operation.
        A Message box will only appear if the state is false
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The JoinResponseMessage.
        Since:
        v1.2

      • handleForceCloseMessage

        private void handleForceCloseMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        If the client needs to be closed this method informs the user about the event and closes the window.
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The ForceCloseMessage.

      • handleKeepAliveMessage

        private void handleKeepAliveMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        This method handles KeepAliveMessages by sending a KeepAliveMessage back to the server. If the KeepAliveManager has been deactivated, this method is not needed.
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - the KeepAliveMessage.

      • handleIdentificationResponseMessage

        private void handleIdentificationResponseMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        This method handles the server's response to a client login attempt. It creates a new user file locally, if needed and shows a prompt if the user name has never been typed in or if the user name and password do not match.
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The IdentificationResponseMessage.

      • handleExceptionMessage

        private void handleExceptionMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        This method handles ExceptionMessages. They are sent to the client when an exception occured. The client is then informed about this event. Afterwards, the client will close.
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The ExceptionMessage.

      • handleBadInputMessage

        private void handleBadInputMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message parsedMessage)
        This method handles BadInputMessages. They are sent to the client when the client sends a bad input (e.g. wrong formatted XML) The client is then informed about this event. The user can decide whether the client shall be shut down or not.
        Parameters:
        parsedMessage - The BadInputMessage.

      • printMessage

        private void printMessage(java.lang.String inputString)
        Adds incoming message to the log file.
        Parameters:
        inputString - The message string.

      • writeUserFile

        private void writeUserFile(java.lang.String userName,
                           java.lang.String identificationCode,
                           java.lang.String serverAddress,
                           java.lang.String serverPort)
        Deprecated. Method not used anymore. Please remove from code
        This method is connected to handleIdentificationResponseMessage(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message). If the user connects to the server for the first time, a file is being created which stores the user's name and identification code.
